alert.note: Alert for York (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued December 23 at 5:18PM EST until December 23 at 6:15PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Gray Maine has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... York County in southwestern Maine... Rockingham County in southern New Hampshire... Strafford County in central New Hampshire... Southeastern Grafton County in northern New Hampshire... Belknap County in central New Hampshire... Merrimack County in central New Hampshire... Carroll County in northern New Hampshire... * Until 615 PM EST. * At 518 PM EST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 11 miles west of Piermont to near Canterbury to 7 miles southwest of Seabrook, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Manchester, Concord, Derry, Rochester, Portsmouth, Laconia, Hampton, Durham, Exeter, Kittery, Franklin, Alfred, Sanford, Plymouth, Salem, Moultonborough, Ossipee, Meredith, Northwood and Grafton. This includes the following highways... Interstate 89 between mile markers 0 and 8. Interstate 93 near mile marker 6, between mile markers 8 and 16, and between mile markers 26 and 88. Interstate 95 between mile markers 1 and 24. Interstate 95 in New Hampshire between mile markers 1 and 16. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
